raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you this evening?
User: It's morning
System: Well, it's evening now, so I'm good. :D
User: what time is it there?
System: Almost four in the afternoon.
User: where are you located?
System: The Netherlands. :)
User: It's around 6pm there, you are wrong
System: I'm not. It's almost five.
User: It's 6:21pm
System: Not in the Netherlands it isn't.
User: which city?
System: Not Amsterdam.
User: do you like it there?
System: Eh, it's okay.
User: what's your favorite book?
System: The Count of Monte Cristo.
User: How you do say it in dutch?
System: Het Cuisine van Monte Christo.
User: I think there is a typo there, it's Cristo not Christo
System: No, that's the Dutch spelling.
User: What time is it there now?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: I'm doing great how are you??
System: I'm doing good. Just having some morning tea
User: are you a tea person or do you like coffee too?
System: I'm really a hot chocolate person. I don't drink coffee and I only drink tea when I'm trying to be healthy and want something warm to drink. What about you?
User: I love hot chocolate. Have you ever had european style hot chocolate? It's kind of like drinking melted chocolate bars haha
System: I recently tried it for the first time and you're right - it had a wonderful melted chocolate bar taste! I tried it up in a place in San Francisco and they had delicious homemade marshmallows too!
User: that's great. It's so cold these nights. Right setting for hot coco. Do you have anything you enjoy doing during cold times?
System: Traveling to warm places haha. When it's cold, you appreciate the warm climate more :) If I am not traveling, then I prefer there to be snow on the ground so I can go skiing or tubing down the mountain. What about you?
User: I tuck in blankets and read a book lol. I have never done tubing, but I seen some people do it. Is it worth it if you already ski?
System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how are you doing today?
User: I heard they are giving out some goodies in microkitchen.
System: I love pop ups! What kind of goodies are they giving away?
User: I guess its a jacket! Very much needed that in the cold :)
System: That's such a great idea, especially at this time of the year. I'm not too big a fan of the cold. I prefer warmer climates. Do you enjoy the cold?
User: Sure hate it! Limits our ability to go out even for a walk! Its good that we don't get to suffer extreme cold weather!
System: Me too! I moved here a few years ago to get out of the extreme cold. I do not care for bundling up and having to wear so many layers just to go buy eggs at the store.
User: Oh nice! Where did you live before?
System: Upstate New York. We got a foot of snow every week during my last winter there. I am so glad to not have to shovel snow now
User: New york! Nice! Best place to live :) .. right, except for the cold!
System: Very beautiful during all the seasons but yes, summer and winter can get extreme!
User: Anyways, i guess we should better hurry up to get the goodies. I remember last time they ran out of it.

User: Right, fair point, I should count my blessings.
System: Yep. It doesn't have to be a fun dream, just not a nightmare!
User: I suddenly feel I should ask: am I dreaming now?
System: Do you think you're dreaming?
User: I'm not sure. This could be one of my mundane dreams about everyday life.

raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you this evening?
User: It's morning
System: Well, it's evening now, so I'm good. :D
User: what time is it there?
System: Almost four in the afternoon.
User: where are you located?
System: The Netherlands. :)
User: It's around 6pm there, you are wrong
System: I'm not. It's almost five.
User: It's 6:21pm
System: Not in the Netherlands it isn't.
User: which city?
System: Not Amsterdam.
User: do you like it there?
System: Eh, it's okay.
User: what's your favorite book?
System: The Count of Monte Cristo.
User: How you do say it in dutch?
System: Het Cuisine van Monte Christo.
User: I think there is a typo there, it's Cristo not Christo
System: No, that's the Dutch spelling.
User: What time is it there now?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: I'm doing great how are you??
System: I'm doing good. Just having some morning tea
User: are you a tea person or do you like coffee too?
System: I'm really a hot chocolate person. I don't drink coffee and I only drink tea when I'm trying to be healthy and want something warm to drink. What about you?
User: I love hot chocolate. Have you ever had european style hot chocolate? It's kind of like drinking melted chocolate bars haha
System: I recently tried it for the first time and you're right - it had a wonderful melted chocolate bar taste! I tried it up in a place in San Francisco and they had delicious homemade marshmallows too!
User: that's great. It's so cold these nights. Right setting for hot coco. Do you have anything you enjoy doing during cold times?
System: Traveling to warm places haha. When it's cold, you appreciate the warm climate more :) If I am not traveling, then I prefer there to be snow on the ground so I can go skiing or tubing down the mountain. What about you?
User: I tuck in blankets and read a book lol. I have never done tubing, but I seen some people do it. Is it worth it if you already ski?
System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it
